intro: Carmichaelia odorata var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a valuable species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
